what: Network Visualization in the ggplot2 Framework
title: Network Visualization in the ggplot2 Framework
text: geomnet package built top recent major ggplot2 release. provides ggplot2 geom called geom_net visualize graphs networks. also include function stat_net calculate network layouts sna package. Finally, function geom_circle included draw circles using ggplot2. can install geomnet directly CRAN install.packages('geomnet') GitLab devtools::install_gitlab("iagogv/geomnet")

title: Network Visualization in the ggplot2 Framework
text: example shows theme inheritance properties theme elements ggplot2. Note: example updated since release ggplot2 2.2.0 content may changed.
code: library(dplyr) library(geomnet) data(theme_elements) # data step TEnet <- fortify(as.edgedf(theme_elements$edges[,c("parent", "child")]), theme_elements$vertices) # create a degree variable for use later TEnet <- TEnet %>%   group_by(from_id) %>%   mutate(degree = sqrt(10 * n() + 1)) # plot ggplot(data = TEnet,        aes(from_id = from_id, to_id = to_id)) +   geom_net(layout.alg = "fruchtermanreingold",     aes(fontsize = degree), directed = TRUE,     labelon = TRUE, size = 1, labelcolour = 'black',     ecolour = "grey70", arrowsize = 0.5,     linewidth = 0.5, repel = TRUE) +   theme_net() +   xlim(c(-0.05, 1.05))

title: Network Visualization in the ggplot2 Framework
text: example, reimagine traditional blood donation diagram directed network. Arrows point blood type receives. example provides two data frames geom_net().
code: library(geomnet) data(blood) ggplot(data = blood$edges, aes(from_id = from, to_id = to)) +   geom_net(colour = "darkred", layout.alg = "circle", labelon = TRUE,             size = 15, directed = TRUE, vjust = 0.5, labelcolour = "grey80",            arrowsize = 1.5, linewidth = 0.5, arrowgap = 0.05,            selfloops = TRUE, ecolour = "grey40") +    theme_net()

title: Network Visualization in the ggplot2 Framework
text: fun example website, tie two students one provides emotional support point book. directed network, visualization, arrow points student receiving support.
code: library(geomnet) head(hp.edges) #>          name1              name2 book #> 1  Dean Thomas Harry James Potter    1 #> 2  Dean Thomas   Hermione Granger    1 #> 3  Dean Thomas Neville Longbottom    1 #> 4  Dean Thomas     Ronald Weasley    1 #> 5  Dean Thomas    Seamus Finnigan    1 #> 6 Fred Weasley     George Weasley    1 head(hp.chars) #>                name schoolyear gender      house #> 1      Adrian Pucey       1989      M  Slytherin #> 2    Alicia Spinnet       1989      F Gryffindor #> 3  Angelina Johnson       1989      F Gryffindor #> 4 Anthony Goldstein       1991      M  Ravenclaw #> 5     Blaise Zabini       1991      M  Slytherin #> 6     C. Warrington       1989      M  Slytherin hp.all <- fortify(as.edgedf(hp.edges), hp.chars, group = "book") #> Using name1 as the from node column and name2 as the to node column. #> If this is not correct, rewrite dat so that the first 2 columns are from and to node, respectively. #> Joining edge and node information by from_id and name respectively. # only plot the characters with any connections in a given book.  ggplot(data=hp.all, aes(from_id = from, to_id = to_id)) +    geom_net(fiteach=T, directed = T, size = 3, linewidth = .5,             ealpha = .5, labelon = T, fontsize = 3, repel = TRUE,             labelcolour = "black", arrowsize = .5, singletons = FALSE,            aes(colour = house, group = house, shape = gender)) +    scale_colour_manual(values = c("#941B08","#F1F31C",                                   "#071A80", "#154C07")) +    facet_wrap(~book, labeller = "label_both") +    theme_net() + theme(panel.background = element_rect(colour = 'black'))

title: Network Visualization in the ggplot2 Framework
text: Now including interactivity ggplotly()!
code: # blood donation example library(geomnet) # devtools::install_github("ropensci/plotly") library(plotly) data(blood) bloodnet <- fortify(as.edgedf(blood$edges), blood$vertices) p <- ggplot(data = bloodnet, aes(from_id = from_id, to_id = to_id))  # create data plot p2 <- p + geom_net(aes(size=Predominance, colour=type, shape=rho, linetype=group_to),              linewidth=0.75, labelon =TRUE, directed = TRUE, labelcolour="black") +   facet_wrap(~Ethnicity) +   scale_colour_brewer(palette="Set2")  ggplotly(p2) %>% hide_legend()  # Classic College Football Example data("football") # data step: merge vertices and edges ftnet <- fortify(as.edgedf(football$edges), football$vertices)  # create data plot gg <- ggplot(data = ftnet,        aes(from_id = from_id, to_id = to_id)) +   geom_net(layout.alg = 'fruchtermanreingold',     aes(colour = value, group = value,         linetype = factor(same.conf != 1)),     linewidth = 0.5,     size = 5, vjust = -0.75, alpha = 0.3) +   theme_net() +   theme(legend.position = "bottom") +   scale_colour_brewer("Conference", palette = "Paired")  +   guides(linetype = "none") ggplotly(gg)

title: Bike sharing network (directed) — bikes
text: network summary bike trips taken customers bike sharing company Capital Bikeshare (https://capitalbikeshare.com) second quarter 2015. trips stations vicinity Rockville, MD, included. data organized list two datasets, vertices (stations) edges (trips stations), follows:

title: Bike sharing network (directed) — bikes
code: bikes

title: Bike sharing network (directed) — bikes
text: list two data frames: trips data set consists four variables length 53: Start.station: Station bike trip starts End.station: Station bike trip ends n: Number trips two stations minlength: Duration shortest trip two stations (seconds). stations included, shortest trip lasted 15 minutes. vertices data set consists five variables information 21 stations: id: Station ID number name: Station name lat: Latitude station location long: Longitude station location nbDocks: Number bike docks station

title: Bike sharing network (directed) — bikes
text: https://capitalbikeshare.com

title: Network of blood types (directed) — blood
text: list two datasets, vertices edges, containing information blood type (see http://www.redcrossblood.org/learn--blood/blood-types). variables follows:

title: Network of blood types (directed) — blood
code: blood

title: Network of blood types (directed) — blood
text: list two data frames: edges data set consists three variables length 27: , : factor variables blood types describing relationship 'compatible ' group_to: factor variable levels '' 'diff' different blood type group regarding rho-gam factor. vertices data set consists five variables 32 rows: label: factor variable blood types, type: factor variable blood type, regarding rhesus factor, rho: factor variable: 'pos' 'neg' describing rhesus factor, Ethnicity: factor variable four variables: 'Caucasians', 'African.American', 'Hispanic', 'Asian', Predominance: numeric variable consisting percentage points blood type within ethnicity.

title: Email network (directed) — email
text: list two datasets, vertices edges, containing data employees (fictitious) email headers two weeks internal GAStech company email employees made available part VAST challenge 2014 (K. Cook, G. Grinstein, M. Whiting, see http://www.cs.umd.edu/hcil/varepository/benchmarks.php). variables follows:

title: Email network (directed) — email
code: email

title: Email network (directed) — email
text: list two data frames: edges data set consists ten variables length 9063: : Email address sender eID:  email ID. email ws sent multiple recipients, email ID . Date: Date time email sent Subject: Subject line email : Email address recipient month: Month email sent day: Day month email sent year: Year email sent nrecipients: Number recipients email nodes data set consists 18 variables information 55 employees: label: Employee's email address LastName: Employee's last name FirstName: Employee's first name BirthDate: Employee's first date BirthCountry: Employee's (fictional) country birth Gender: Employee's gender CitizenshipCountry: Employee's (fictional) country citizenship CitizenshipBasis: citizenship birth parents? CitizenshipStartDate: employee became citizen PassportCountry: (Fictional) country issuing employee's passport PassportIssueDate: Date employee received passport PassportExpirationDate: Date employee's passport expires CurrentEmploymentType: Employee's department company CurrentEmploymentTitle: Employee's title company CurrentEmploymentStartDate: Date employee started position MilitaryServiceBranch: Branch (fictional) military employee serves MilitaryDischargeType: General honorable discharge military service?

title: College football games network (undirected) — football
text: list two datasets, vertices edges, containing data Division college football games Fall 2000 season. variables follows:

title: College football games network (undirected) — football
code: football

title: College football games network (undirected) — football
text: list two data frames: edges data set consists three variables length 613: , : Character variables describing teams playing game .conf: indicator variable 1 two teams conference 0 otherwise. vertices data set consists two variables information 115 Division schools: label: Character variable containing school names value: Character variable containing conference schools

title: College football games network (undirected) — football
text: M. Girvan M. E. J. Newman, Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. USA 99, 7821-7826 (2002).

title: College football games network (undirected) — football
code: # data step: merge vertices and edges ftnet <- merge(   football$edges, football$vertices,   by.x = "from", by.y = "label", all = TRUE )  # label independent schools ftnet$schools <- ifelse(ftnet$value == "Independents", ftnet$from, "")  library(geomnet) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union # create data plot ggplot(data = ftnet,        aes(from_id = from, to_id = to)) +   geom_net(     aes(       colour = value, group = value,       linetype = factor(1-same.conf),       label = schools     ),     linewidth = 0.5,     size = 5, vjust = -0.75, alpha = 0.3,     layout.alg = 'fruchtermanreingold'   ) +   theme_net() +   theme(legend.position = "bottom") +   scale_colour_brewer("Conference", palette = "Paired")

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(geomnet) data(blood) p <- ggplot(data = blood$edges, aes(from_id = from, to_id = to)) p + geom_net(vertices=blood$vertices, aes(colour=..type..)) + theme_net()  bloodnet <- fortify(as.edgedf(blood$edges), blood$vertices) p <- ggplot(data = bloodnet, aes(from_id = from_id, to_id = to_id)) p + geom_net() p + geom_net(aes(colour=rho)) + theme_net() p + geom_net(aes(colour=rho), labelon=TRUE, vjust = -0.5) p + geom_net(aes(colour=rho, linetype = group_to, label = from_id),                vjust=-0.5, labelcolour="black", directed=TRUE) +       theme_net() p + geom_net(colour = "orange", layout.alg = 'circle', size = 6) p + geom_net(colour = "orange", layout.alg = 'circle', size = 6, linewidth=.75) p + geom_net(colour = "orange", layout.alg = 'circle', size = 0, linewidth=.75,              directed = TRUE) p + geom_net(aes(size=Predominance, colour=rho, shape=rho, linetype=group_to),              linewidth=0.75, labelon =TRUE, labelcolour="black") +     facet_wrap(~Ethnicity) +     scale_colour_brewer(palette="Set2") gg <- ggplot(data = blood$edges, aes(from_id = from, to_id = to)) +   geom_net(colour = "darkred", layout.alg = "circle", labelon=TRUE, size = 15,          directed = TRUE, vjust = 0.5, labelcolour = "grey80",          arrowsize = 1.5, linewidth = 0.5, arrowgap = 0.05,          selfloops = TRUE, ecolour = "grey40") +   theme_net() gg dframe <- ggplot_build(gg)$data[[1]] # contains calculated node and edge values  #Madmen Relationships data(madmen) MMnet <- fortify(as.edgedf(madmen$edges), madmen$vertices) p <- ggplot(data = MMnet, aes(from_id = from_id, to_id = to_id)) p + geom_net(labelon=TRUE) p + geom_net(aes(colour=Gender), size=6, linewidth=1, labelon=TRUE, fontsize=3, labelcolour="black") p + geom_net(aes(colour=Gender), size=6, linewidth=1, labelon=TRUE, labelcolour="black") +     scale_colour_manual(values=c("#FF69B4", "#0099ff")) + xlim(c(-.05,1.05)) p + geom_net(aes(colour=Gender), size=6, linewidth=1, directed=TRUE, labelon=TRUE,              arrowgap=0.01, labelcolour="black") +     scale_colour_manual(values=c("#FF69B4", "#0099ff")) + xlim(c(-.05,1.05))  p <- ggplot(data = MMnet, aes(from_id = from_id, to_id = to_id)) # alternative labelling: specify label aesthetic. p + geom_net(aes(colour=Gender, label=Gender), size=6, linewidth=1, fontsize=3,              labelcolour="black")  ## visualizing ggplot2 theme elements data(theme_elements) TEnet <- fortify(as.edgedf(theme_elements$edges[,c(2,1)]), theme_elements$vertices) ggplot(data = TEnet, aes(from_id = from_id, to_id = to_id)) +   geom_net(labelon=TRUE, vjust=-0.5)  ## emails example from VastChallenge 2014 # care has to be taken to make sure that for each panel all nodes are included with # the necessary information. # Otherwise line segments show on the plot without nodes. emailedges <- as.edgedf(subset(email$edges, nrecipients < 54)) emailnet <- fortify(emailedges, email$nodes) #no facets ggplot(data = emailnet, aes(from_id = from_id, to_id = to_id)) +   geom_net(aes(colour= CurrentEmploymentType), linewidth=0.5) +   scale_colour_brewer(palette="Set2") #facet by day  emailnet <- fortify(emailedges, email$nodes, group = "day") ggplot(data = emailnet, aes(from_id = from, to_id = to_id)) +   geom_net(aes(colour= CurrentEmploymentType), linewidth=0.5, fiteach=TRUE) +   scale_colour_brewer(palette="Set2") +   facet_wrap(~day, nrow=2) + theme(legend.position="bottom") ggplot(data = emailnet, aes(from_id = from, to_id = to_id)) +   geom_net(aes(colour= CitizenshipCountry), linewidth=0.5, fiteach=TRUE) +   scale_colour_brewer(palette="Set2") +   facet_wrap(~day, nrow=2) + theme(legend.position="bottom") ggplot(data = emailnet, aes(from_id = from, to_id = to_id)) +   geom_net(aes(colour= CurrentEmploymentType), linewidth=0.5, fiteach=FALSE) +   scale_colour_brewer(palette="Set2") +   facet_wrap(~day, nrow=2) + theme(legend.position="bottom")  ## Les Miserables example data(lesmis) lesmisnet <- fortify(as.edgedf(lesmis$edges), lesmis$vertices[, c(2,1)]) p <- ggplot(data=lesmisnet, aes(from_id=from_id, to_id=to_id)) p + geom_net(layout.alg="fruchtermanreingold") p + geom_net(layout.alg="fruchtermanreingold", labelon=TRUE, vjust=-0.5) p + geom_net(layout.alg="fruchtermanreingold", labelon=TRUE, vjust=-0.5,     aes(linewidth=degree/5))  ## College Football Games in the Fall 2000 regular season # Source: http://www-/personal.umich.edu/~mejn/netdata/ data(football) ftnet <- fortify(as.edgedf(football$edges), football$vertices) p <- ggplot(data=ftnet, aes(from_id=from_id, to_id=to_id)) p + geom_net(aes(colour=value), linewidth=0.75, size=4.5, ecolour="grey80") +   scale_colour_brewer("Conference", palette="Paired") + theme_net() +   theme(legend.position="bottom")  ## **GGplot2** theme attribute inheritance network if(requireNamespace("ggrepel", quietly = TRUE)){ library(dplyr) data(theme_elements) # data step TEnet <- fortify(as.edgedf(theme_elements$edges[,c("parent", "child")]), theme_elements$vertices) # create a degree variable for use later TEnet <- TEnet %>%   group_by(from_id) %>%   mutate(degree = sqrt(10 * n() + 1)) # plot ggplot(data = TEnet,        aes(from_id = from_id, to_id = to_id)) +   geom_net(layout.alg = "fruchtermanreingold",     aes(fontsize = degree), directed = TRUE,     labelon = TRUE, size = 1, labelcolour = 'black',     ecolour = "grey70", arrowsize = 0.5,     linewidth = 0.5, repel = TRUE) +   theme_net() +   xlim(c(-0.05, 1.05)) } } # }

title: geomnet 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-12-08 version geomnet updated account changes ggplot2 version 2.2.0.

title: geomnet 0.2.0
text: Introduction "adjmat" "edgedf" classes newly added fortify methods. fortify methods included "network", "igraph", "adjmat", "edgedf" class objects transform network objects data frame objects can visualized using geom_net(). Legend icons updated better represent network data. micro-network drawn instead single point line. Added plotly functionality. Hovertext describes edges provides node labels. Note arrows currently supported plotly, directed networks appear undirected. New logical parameter singletons added plotting nodes network even indegree outdegree zero. likely useful facetting. default TRUE, nodes plotted panels. singletons = FALSE, nodes plotted panel(s) least one incoming outgoing edge.

title: geomnet 0.2.0
text: Plotting labels slightly different. Use labelon = TRUE plot labels node ids. Use label inside aes() map variable value node label. selfies argument drawing self-loops nodes changed selfloops.

title: geomnet 0.2.0
text: Vignette added several side--side comparison examples geomnet GGally::ggnet2() ggnetwork François Briatte
